name: Easy Squash Fritters
author: K Hillbilly
summary: A great way to use that summer excess of zucchini or yellow squash. Everyone loves these fritters, even kids. In the summer we have these at least once a week. They go well as a side with almost anything.
ingredients: ½ cup all-purpose baking mix (such as Bisquick®)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 pinch garlic and herb seasoning, or more to taste
⅓ cup oil for frying, or as needed
directions: Mix grated squash, baking mix, milk, egg, Parmesan cheese, butter, salt, pepper, and garlic-herb seasoning together in a large bowl
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Drop tablespoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil about 1 inch apart
Cook for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes; flip and continue cooking until lightly browned on the second side
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate
Repeat with remaining batter, adding oil to the skillet as needed
